sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Suppose A={1,2,3} and B={2,3,4}, and C={3,4,5}. Find the values of (A △ B) x C and A △ (B x C), and show that they are not equal, thereby proving that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
